lion-reaction1.speaker: Takara
lion-reaction1.text: Lion-chan…@ the little one with the bright fins?@ She talks too much about you.@ The way her colors flare whenever your name drifts through her mind—@ it's almost sweet.

lion-reaction2.speaker: Takara
lion-reaction2.text: A friend?@ Hm.@ Friends shouldn't flutter so close to what's already claimed.@ It makes the currents restless.@ I might need to... calm them down.

options.text: What do you mean by that?

lion-jealous1.speaker: Takara
lion-jealous1.text: Jealous?@ Maybe I am.@ I don't like sharing light.@ Some creatures don't understand boundaries until the tide shows them where to go.

lion-leaves.speaker: Takara
lion-leaves.text: Stay here.@ The currents are loud tonight.@ I'll quiet them and be right back.

lion-leaves.speaker: System
lion-leaves.text: [Takara slips away into the murk. You can't see her, but the water feels heavier. A faint pulse echoes once... then silence.]

lion-leaves.speaker: Takara
lion-leaves.text: There.@ Everything feels still again.@ The currents won't tug you toward her ship anymore.

lion-calm1.speaker: Takara
lion-calm1.text: Calm?@ Of course.@ Sometimes the sea just needs a little persuasion.@ Now it carries only your voice.

options.text: You frightened her away, didn't you?

lion-press1.speaker: Takara
lion-press1.text: Frightened?@ Perhaps.@ The ocean is vast, and some swim too close to storms they don't understand.@ She'll stay far away now.@ That's safer for everyone.

lion-end.speaker: Takara
lion-end.text: No more interruptions.@ No more distractions.@ Just you and the quiet current that always leads back to me.
